review.author: Molly T.
review.description: Picture this: you de-train by Prospect Park with your beau. As you embark on your journey across the park into Crown Heights, the sun begins to set. You hear the sweet sounds of an outdoor...

review.author: Vin S.
review.description: This is judging mayfield as a (my 3rd burger here) burger spot. 2 adjustments to their routine and this place goes from good to great. They PURPOSELY overcook/burn their fries til they're crunchy...

review.author: Heather M.
review.description: Staple neighborhood restaurant. Love drinking wine and oysters at happy hour, having a Kale Salad for brunch, or indulging in the steak for dinner. You've heard all this before. I'm really...

review.author: Heather L.
review.description: First off, I love the ambiance of this place. Great exposed brick, comfy wooden bench seating, and an open bar/kitchen. A great kind of place to chill and catch up w/friends over brunch - you...

review.author: Glenn D.
review.description: Eating here has led me to start my own "Hidden Gems" list on Yelp! Crown Heights is a neighborhood on the verge of gentrifying so Mayfield held down a great spot! But I'd even go so far to...

review.author: Tukta H.
review.description: One of the good restaurants in this neighborhood. They are happy hour oyster bar each $1 . Restaurant is pretty busy everyday, sometime might be a little wait. My favorite dish here is Berkshire...

review.author: Anabel M.
review.description: great brunch place! A little expensive, but worth it for a special occasion. Really delicious bloody mary

review.author: Brian L.
review.description: Came here for dinner with friends, who had never actually been here for dinner (just branch) and they were pretty disappointed. As for my own experience, I thought that the food was really...

review.author: Kristen L.
review.description: This spot is no frills, legit good food, and some kick ass drinks. This is why Brooklyn is so amazing: you don't need gimmicks to just provide a solid dining experience. My friend and I came...

review.author: Linda M.
review.description: I love the Mayfield! I've always enjoyed the oysters. Their fresh pasta is delicious every single time! The other night I had the gnocchi with pork ragu. I enjoyed it alot!!!! The gnocchi was...

review.author: Mary F.
review.description: Deserves 3.5 stars. Good hangout spot (just don't sit near the kitchen or you'll smell like it). Seats weren't that hard to get on a Saturday night for 4. About 10-15 min wait so not too shabby....

review.author: Jeffrey R.
review.description: Great brunch/lunch spot. We got the lunch special that came with a glass of house wine- you can't beat a glass of wine with your food. The ambiance is amazing, love the decor. The food is very...

review.author: Michelle B.
review.description: I was supposed to grab dinner with my friend in the city, but she changed it up last minute to come here. I went from Brooklyn to the city and back to Brooklyn, but I can't even be mad because...

review.author: Elizabeth F.
review.description: Perfect spot for great food and great conversation. I came here on a Sunday night with my dad and boyfriend. We ordered cocktails, entrees and dessert and loved everything. The wait staff was...

review.author: Ashti D.
review.description: Since I couldn't help myself because im a protein junkie...I had the steak and eggs which was super delicious...and the service was super too. The hostess greeted us with a warm welcome and...

review.author: Peter N.
review.description: To sum it up, it's basically a casual brunch spot where you actually spend the time enjoying the company you're with rather than fawn over the dishes being served. Good service & okay food....

review.author: Karen F.
review.description: What a wonderful restaurant! I will definitely be back if I am ever in Brooklyn. I loved the atmosphere. My friend and I sat in the middle by the high top tables for brunch on a Saturday afternoon....

review.author: Jeannette N.
review.description: I came here for brunch recently and thoroughly enjoyed their Poached Eggs dish which comes with grilled tasso ham, grit cakes, sauce charon, and scallions. It's assembled the same as an eggs...

review.author: Tiffany I.
review.description: I made reservations for 3 people for brunch at 12pm. Got there about 2-3 minutes early and it was already packed; we waited about 20 min to get seated. The Atlantic Eggs Benedict plate was...

review.author: Kelsea Z.
review.description: Food: loved the smoked salmon platter.. It came as a build your own with a bagel, cream cheese, onions, tomatoes, capers and the salmon.. Salmon is smoked in house... Friends got smoked salmon...

hreview.description: The oysters are delicious, the best I've ever had. Scallops to die for. If you like ice cream sundaes, go for it.
I will not ever go back to this place. The food is ok but the service stinks. I went on a Saturday afternoon to grab a burger. Although the place was packed, they only had one bartender working...

hreview.summary: Amazing food in an unprentious atmosphere
hreview.description: I have been to Mayfield twice and each time enjoyed my meal thoroughly. The second time I had the burger and thought it was among the best, if not THE best, I ever had. The spoon bread side...
Mayfield is the newest addition to Franklin Ave and it is great. The menu is a bit 'interesting' but what you recieve is amazing. I was overly impressed by each thing we ordered. It tastes...

review.author: Kevin Mare
review.description: The mayfield has everything from great food to awesome cocktails. The service was impeccable and my friends and I had a blast just hanging with Greg the bartender. He is one cool kat.

review.author: Jacky Balestiero
review.description: I had brunch at Mayfield for the first time this morning and absolutely loved it! Great food and service; very clean; casual ambiance - would highly recommend! I can't wait to come back.

review.alternativeheadline: Do We Detect a Southern Drawl?
review.description: Mayfield, which opened in October in Crown Heights, Brooklyn, is broadly American in mission, with an occasional Southern twang.

metatags.headline: Mayfield
metatags.nyml_hours: Kitchen: Sun-Thu, 5:30pm-11pm; Fri-Sat, 5:30pm-12am Bar: Sun-Thu, 5pm-2am; Fri-Sat, 5pm-4am
metatags.nyml_main_website_blurb: This Crown Heights den offers upscale down-home fare that manages to be both delicate and hearty. The space lacks pretension—one wall has exposed brick, and the other has a television with the Rangers game playing. The food follows suit: The crisp fried quail, a signature of the menu, is a medley of buttermilk and Old Bay that accentuates the slight gaminess of the bird. It’s served with a side of honey-bourbon sauce that’s stronger than some of their cocktails. Grilled octopus is another example of the mix of high and low. A generous cut of the sea beast, poached then grilled for tenderness, is married with white beans and a slice of pork belly that has been cooked in duck confit and then glazed and fried. If there’s still room on your ribs after the decadent entrées, the pot du crème is a chocolate delight, with hints of orange whipped into a puddinglike consistency.
metatags.nyml_photo_gallery: Emily Bennett Coles Emily Bennett Coles Emily Bennett Coles Emily Bennett Coles
metatags.nyml_search_teaser: This Crown Heights den offers upscale down-home fare that manages to be both delicate and hearty.
metatags.nyml_suggested_text: Grilled octopus, $15; buttermilk fried quail, $20; roasted Brussels sprouts, $10; pot du crème, $6
